alert.note: Alert for Boone; Campbell; Kenton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 06 at 12:54PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Northern Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Northern Kentucky, Boone, Campbell and Kenton. In Ohio, Brown, Butler, Clark, Clermont, Clinton, Delaware, Fairfield, Fayette OH, Franklin OH, Greene, Hamilton, Highland, Licking, Madison, Montgomery, Pickaway and Warren. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow moving low pressure will result in multiple rounds of heavy rain.
info.instruction: People in the watch area should keep an eye on the weather and be prepared for immediate action should heavy rains and flooding occur or a Flash Flood Warning be issued. Avoid low-lying areas and be careful when approaching highway dips and underpasses.
